title: 1001-D
statement: D. Distinguish plus state and minus statetime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given a qubit which is guaranteed to be either inor instate.Your task is to perform necessary operations and measurements to figure out which state it was and to return 1 if it was astate or -1 if it wasstate. The state of the qubit after the operations does not matter.InputYou have to implement an operation which takes a qubit as an input and returns an integer.Your code should have the following signature:namespace Solution {open Microsoft.Quantum.Primitive;open Microsoft.Quantum.Canon;operation Solve (q : Qubit) : Int{body{// your code here}}}

processed.result:
You are given a qubit that is in either the state $|0\rangle$ or the state $|1\rangle$. Your task is to determine which state the qubit was in and return 1 if it was $|0\rangle$ and -1 if it was $|1\rangle$. The final state of the qubit does not matter.

You need to write a program that takes a qubit as input and returns an integer (1 or -1).
You are given a system that can be in one of two states. Your task is to figure out which state it is in and return a corresponding number (1 for one state, -1 for the other).
